      This is a boolean value that is used in the setDirection(int, int) method to flag whether or not a Taha object is in 'sight' of the Ninja.

      • getDirection

        public int getDirection()
        Simply returns the value stored in direction
        Returns:
        direction

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(int row,
                int col)
        This method passes in the coordinates of the Player's object on the Grid, and checks to see if they are in sight of the NinjaOctopi. A player is considered as being in sight if they are within two grid spaces of the NinjaOctopi object, in any adjacent direction. If the player is in sight, then direction will be given the corresponding value for that direction. If the player is not in sight, then direction will be given a random value 1 - 4.
        Parameters:
        row - coordinate of the first index of the Taha objects position(y pos)
        col - coordinate of the second index of the Taha objects position(x pos)

      • getPlayerInSight

        public boolean getPlayerInSight()
        Returns playerInSight
        Returns:
        playerInSight

      • resetPlayerInSight

        public void resetPlayerInSight()
        Used to set playerInSight to false.

      • gotShot

        public void gotShot()
        Sets isShot to true, signalling that the NinjaOcopi has been 'shot'.

      • totallyGotShot

        public boolean totallyGotShot()
        Returns isShot
        Returns:
        isShot

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method is used to give information about what symbol the NinjaOctopi should be associated with visually on the Grid. If the NinjaOctopi is 'seen' by the player on the Grid, then it will display its true symbol.
        Specified by:
        toString in interface GridMember
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        "[*]" if the Ninja is not seen, and "[O]" if the Ninja is seen

      • toImage

        public javax.swing.ImageIcon toImage()
        This method was meant for use in the Graphical User Interface, however it was never completed. It works similarly to the toString() method.
        Specified by:
        toImage in interface GridMember
